name: Creamy Corned Beef Hash Pinwheels
description: A delicious twist on traditional pinwheels that make for a fast and filling breakfast or brunch food.
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can HORMEL® Mary Kitchen® Corned Beef Hash
2 (8 ounce) packages refrigerated seamless crescent dough sheets (such as Pillsbury®)
1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened - divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add corned beef hash and break up larger chunks. Cook  until browned on one side, 5 to 8 minutes. Turn and brown other side. Sprinkle with garlic powder and ground pepper. Transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate.

Spread 1 dough sheet out onto lightly greased sheet of waxed paper. Spread half of the cream cheese over the dough sheet, leaving a 1/2-inch margin all around. Spoon half of the cooked corned beef hash evenly over cream cheese. Roll dough up into a log, starting at a long edge. Repeat steps to make another log with second dough sheet.
Cut each roll into 1/2-inch thick slices (you should end up with 16 rolls total.) Place slices onto an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until pinwheels are golden brown, 12 to 14 minutes. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: 7.15.17 First I couldn t believe how little grease cooked out of the corned beef hash (I ve never before had it canned). This recipe couldn t be simpler and was a nice change from just good old corned beef hash and eggs. I think there are many variations you could do. I was thinking adding some red pepper flakes to the hash while it s browning adding some chopped parsley to give it a little pop of color or instead of regular cream cheese spreading the dough with some pimento cream cheese spread etc. Would recommend leaving your dough sheets in the fridge until you re ready to fill and roll them. I spread my hash mixture while it was warm which softened the dough making it a little difficult to roll tightly. In the future I ll let the hash cool down a bit more. Really enjoyed the simplicity of this and it was a nice Saturday morning breakfast paired with some fresh fruit.

I love pinwheels with breakfast sausage and this is just as good. I wouldn't have thought to use corned beef hash, so I'm glad this creative submitter showed me how to do something different with the corned beef.

We really enjoyed this recipe and ate it as a light dinner. I made just one change....after browning the hash I added the cream cheese directly to the pan let it melt and stirred it in. I used about 6 ounces. It turned out delicious!
Easy and fun breakfast recipe! I love having an alternative breakfast idea and will be making this again.

This recipe was a cute idea and would be perfect for kids or on a brunch table. The crescent rolls cooked perfectly and the inside was creamy and delicious! I think they would be great with a sprinkle of green onions or chives inside for a little crunch.

This is a great idea and it turned out very tasty! It is very decadent but worth it to indulge every now and then. These are great for breakfast but just as good anytime. We had them as a breakfast for dinner night. Will make again.

I used crescent rolls instead of dough sheets just because I already had them on hand. I hadn't ever made anything with corned beef hash before so I picked a recipe that seemed easy. It turned out great! I would make this again. Thank You for the recipe!

It was good but i would definitely double the cream cheese next time! I also used this idea to make a breakfast scramble pinwheel. I used a cheddar cheese sauce then scrambled eggs, ground country pork and crumbled up some ready-bacon. Rolled it up and cut it the same way. Baked 20 min. Turned out so good! I really think this dish can be reinterpreted a number of great ways!
Great recipe and easy to make! I used some corned beef hash from a local restaurant as opposed to hormel. Turned out great!
